items.content:
Hubstaff

Senior Server Engineer

Hubstaff is a fast-growing startup in the time tracking and project management space that fully embraces remote work. You work when and where you want. We care a lot about our culture, having fun while working hard, and our annual retreats. We are looking for a talented server engineer who has 5+ years of experience in Ruby on Rails and several years of experience with Vue.js or React to join our passionate development team and work on our up and coming task management product. The correct person will take pride in their work, have extreme attention to detail, and be able to get their hands dirty implementing Rails controllers, Vue.js components, and doing HTML & CSS front-end work. We are looking for a well-rounded Ruby on Rails developer who has the front-end chops to implement the user-facing aspects of their projects using Vue.js. This position will report to our one of the Hubstaff server team leads and work closely with our other engineers. You’ll be able to work 100% remotely, and we are looking for someone that can grow with our products for years to come. This is a long-term (years, our hope is forever) full-time (40 hrs/wk) 1099 (hourly) contract role. Some of the benefits of working for us is our company-hosted annual retreat, that you get to choose your own schedule, work where you want (cafe, co-working location, your home, anywhere), don't have to ask for permission when you want to take time off, get to dedicate yourself to one project at a time, and have job security and a career path for years to come (we've run the company using positive cash flow from day one and are carefully growing the team and business). You’ll be a good fit if you: * Are self-disciplined and have a great work ethic * Have good time management skills * Communicate well * Love to learn new things * Are a full-stack engineer (UI/UX, backend, etc.) * Can work until at least 1pm EST (M - F) * Have at least 5 years of server-side experience (requirement) Backend Development Requirements: * Ruby on Rails * Postgres or MySQL * Unit tests (rspec, Jest, etc.) * Background workers (Sidekiq) * Working from design docs/specifications & wireframes Front-end Development Requirements: * Vue.js or React * Highly skilled with HTML & CSS * Bootstrap * Javascript & jQuery Bonus: * Solr * Sidekiq * Service workers architecture * Advanced SQL (query optimization, locking, etc.)

items.content:
Senior Server Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Electronic Time Tracking, SaaS
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Hubstaff | No office location

Technologies

ruby-on-rails
reactjs
ruby
vue.js

Job description

Hubstaff is a fast-growing startup in the time tracking and project management space that fully embraces remote work. You work when and where you want. We care a lot about our culture, having fun while working hard, and our annual retreats.

We are looking for a talented server engineer who has 5+ years of experience in Ruby on Rails and several years of experience with Vue.js or React to join our passionate development team and work on our up and coming task management product.

The correct person will take pride in their work, have extreme attention to detail, and be able to get their hands dirty implementing Rails controllers, Vue.js components, and doing HTML & CSS front-end work.

We are looking for a well-rounded Ruby on Rails developer who has the front-end chops to implement the user-facing aspects of their projects using Vue.js.

This position will report to our one of the Hubstaff server team leads and work closely with our other engineers. You’ll be able to work 100% remotely, and we are looking for someone that can grow with our products for years to come.

This is a long-term (years, our hope is forever) full-time (40 hrs/wk) 1099 (hourly) contract role. Some of the benefits of working for us is our company-hosted annual retreat, that you get to choose your own schedule, work where you want (cafe, co-working location, your home, anywhere), don't have to ask for permission when you want to take time off, get to dedicate yourself to one project at a time, and have job security and a career path for years to come (we've run the company using positive cash flow from day one and are carefully growing the team and business).

You’ll be a good fit if you:

  • Are self-disciplined and have a great work ethic
  • Have good time management skills
  • Communicate well
  • Love to learn new things
  • Are a full-stack engineer (UI/UX, backend, etc.)
  • Can work until at least 1pm EST (M - F)
  • Have at least 5 years of server-side experience (requirement)

Backend Development Requirements:

  • Ruby on Rails
  • Postgres or MySQL
  • Unit tests (rspec, Jest, etc.)
  • Background workers (Sidekiq)
  • Working from design docs/specifications & wireframes

Front-end Development Requirements:

  • Vue.js or React
  • Highly skilled with HTML & CSS
  • Bootstrap
  • Javascript & jQuery

Bonus:

  • Solr
  • Sidekiq
  • Service workers architecture
  • Advanced SQL (query optimization, locking, etc.)
Apply now

About Hubstaff

At Hubstaff we love doing things the "Right way" by talking to customers, writing specs, having copious amounts of unit testing, conducting peer code reviews, trying to break things during QA, and sleeping well at night. But we're always looking for ways to improve. People rarely work more than 40 hrs/wk and we spend 0% of our time fighting fires.

There's no babysitting. You're in charge of yourself. That means you work where and when you want.

Culture is really important to us. But building culture in a remote team can be difficult. We do a lot of things to try to remedy that. Chief among them are our annual retreats. Last year our retreat was in Lisbon, Portugal. We had a hackathon, broke out of escape rooms, and ate lots of good food.

There's always something challenging to work and great people to spend your days with building things at Hubstaff.

Benefits

  • Flexible schedule
  • Remote / Work from home
  • Annual retreat
  • Job security / Long term

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
About Clearmatics


Clearmatics is a B2B fintech startup building P2P protocols and tools for automating the finance industry. Specifically, we design protocols and build platforms for decentralised Financial Market Infrastructure (dFMI).


Founded in 2015, we are a London-based blockchain R&D company, whose mission is to build peer-to-peer infrastructures that solve issues and inefficiencies inherent to today's client-server architectures. We call our technology approach 'decentralized automation', which combines cryptography,
consensus protocols and economic mechanism design. We have good ties to the Open Source / Ethereum community, we work closely with the Ethereum Foundation, and the company is an Ethereum Enterprise Alliance Member.


We are scaling rapidly and looking to hire a Business Intelligence Developer to join our operations team, working closely with our Head of Finance and Operations, building our internal BI capability and supporting the operations of the business by producing relevant analytical data.



About You


You are a team player, comfortable working under your own steam and are used to working in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

As our Business Intelligence Developer, you will report directly to the Head of Finance and Operations. Your primary focus is to build, maintain and support BI technical solutions to produce intuitive, visual, analytical data for enhanced insights and decision making.

You will be a self-starter, pragmatic with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, as well as a strong sense of 'what good looks like'. You will thrive in a fast-paced and self-learning environment and contribute well in a team setting.



Responsibilities


In this role, you will be responsible for:



  • Identifying, implementing and maintaining a scalable BI system (via in-house or external software) using ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) framework.

  • Working with stakeholders across the business to define and implement a standard, internal data structure.

  • Ensuring that a robust interface created between systems to eradicate duplication and errors and create a common data architecture for associative reporting.

  • Build and own web-based, highly visual BI reporting dashboards and flexible query tools to enable rapid query retrieval from multiple systems/databases and facilitate a “self-service” approach from the users.

  • Designing tools in code within the BI system to enable real-time reporting, including real-time P&L and computation of rolling forecasts.

  • Merging and streamlining current systems/databases to reduce the number of databases and tools currently in operation.

  • Moving the Finance workflow emphasis away from Access/Excel databases to stronger more robust technology.

  • Enabling direct database queries into Excel to facilitate automatic data table population.

  • Regularly review the changing needs of the business in terms of MI requirements and delivery.

  • Researching, implementing and advising internally on technology solutions to current and future processes.



REQUIREMENTS


MUST-HAVES



  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills - able to articulate what "good" looks like.

  • 5+ years of implementing technology solutions.

  • Very strong experience of working in a financial services environment or similar industry working with big data.

  • Good eye for BI visuals, including graphical presentations and user-friendly reports.

  • Appreciation of basic accountancy, e.g. balancing a balance sheet and cashflow statements, budgets and forecasts, and entity consolidation.

  • In-depth technical expertise of business intelligence software, e.g Qlik, Microsoft Power BI or Tableau.

  • Standard MS Office package and accounting software.



SHOULD-HAVES



  • A degree in Computer Science

  • Strong Excel skills incl VBA programming and plug-ins.

  • Experience working with APIs and data structures.

  • Solid knowledge of the industry, including terms and language.



NICE-TO-HAVES



  • Accounting experience/qualification

  • Interest in digital currency

  • Demonstrable interest in blockchain technology

  • Previous experience working in a start-up environment




WHAT WE VALUE AT CLEARMATICS



  • Collaboration and respect.

  • Honesty & Humility.

  • Ability to challenge ideas.

  • Willingness to deliver robust solutions.

  • Passion for the technology and its challenges.

  • Continuous improvement and learning.




PERKS AND BENEFITS



  • Central London location in bright, spacious offices.

  • Competitive salary.

  • Flexible working and possibility to work remote.

  • Relocation assistance.

  • Company pension.

  • Hardware budget to give our developers the best equipment.

  • Professional development - annual individual Learning & Development budget.

  • Monthly Friday company meeting with pizza and beers.

  • "Show and Tell" sessions - knowledge sharing across teams.

  • Great kitchen filled with your favourite British specialties.

  • Join a fast-growing, game-changing, FinTech company ;)

items.content:
JOB SUMMARY

TheAnalystposition for the CBRE Business Analytics group supports a project manager and technical lead forbusiness intelligence projects focused on real estate data analyses for CBRE'sclients. Through data warehousing, visualization, and examination, this positionhelps our clients optimize their operations across all service lines:facilities management, project management, finance, portfolio administration,cost forecasting, etc.

An analyst works closely with our clients anddatabase technical team to automate data collection from source operationalsystems, aggregate and standardize the information in a data warehouse, anddevelop Tableau dashboards that leverage the warehouse to generate meaningfulclient insights. The analyst will work with the Service Delivery team duringthe standup of initial solutions, as well as the Expert Solutions CenterOngoing Support team post-delivery. The Ongoing Support team focuses onmaintaining and enhancing our business intelligence projects.

Additionally, the CBRE Business Analytics grouphelps our clients develop budgets, benchmark facility operating costs, andpredict upcoming capital requirements. An analyst supports projects to collectthe requisite client real estate data, build and refine cost models using CBREtools, and present a meaningful financial story in formal reports andbriefings.

The ideal candidate possesses a broad skill set.Required skills include: technical capabilities with data manipulation and datamodeling; intermediate to advanced Tableau knowledge; some project management experience;and client-facing communications. Experience in the corporate real estateoutsourcing industry is preferred. Minimum of three years of experience. Advanced degree not requiredbut preferred. Office is based in Santa Barbara, CA but work from home oranother CBRE office is an option.

COMPANY PROFILE

CBRE Group, Inc. (NYSE:CBG), a Fortune 500 andS&P 500 company headquartered in Los Angeles, is the world's largestcommercial real estate services and investment firm (in terms of 2013revenue). The Company has approximately 44,000 employees (excludingaffiliates), and serves real estate owners, investors and occupiers throughapproximately 350 offices (excluding affiliates) worldwide. CBRE offersstrategic advice and execution for property sales and leasing; corporateservices; property, facilities and project management; mortgage banking;appraisal and valuation; development services; investment management; andresearch and consulting. Please visit our website at.

Based in Santa Barbara, CA, this officeprovides consulting services, cloud and server-based software tools, andstatistical indices that solve real estate business problems through robustdata analytics. While the work is fast paced and challenging, the environmentis casual and flexible.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES ANDRESPONSIBILITIES

Support both technical and project manager leads forbusiness intelligence and facility cost analyses projects for a variety ofcorporate and government clients.

Create, maintain and optimize creative datavisualizations and dashboards (primarily in Tableau) to derive actionableintelligence.

Aggregation and analysis of quantitative data;forecast and trending of performance data.

Process mapping and efficiency analysis.

Support on problem solving team that developsrecommendations based on data interpretations.

Provide subject matter expertise on data-relatedprocesses and analyses.

Collect key financial and real estate portfoliodata from clients for inclusion in cost models.

Develop and refine facility cost models foroperating and maintain a real estate portfolio using CBRE proprietary softwareand other analytical tools.

Prepare formal written reports describing projectmethodology, scope, key assumptions, and results.

Present progress and results to clients (bothin-person and virtually) and collects feedback for revisions.

Miscellaneous technical support for marketingmaterials, and data support for CBRE software systems.

SUPERVISORYRESPONSIBILITIES

Noformalsupervisoryresponsibilitiesinthisposition.Providesinformalassistancesuchastechnicalguidance,and/ortrainingtocoworkers.


QUALIFICATIONS

Toperformthisjobsuccessfully,anindividualmustbeabletoperformeachessentialdutysatisfactorily.Therequirementslistedbelowarerepresentativeoftheknowledge,skill,and/orabilityrequired.

Reasonableaccommodationsmaybemadetoenableindividualswithdisabilitiestoperformtheessentialfunctions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

Bachelor'sdegree(BA/BS)fromfour-yearcollegeoruniversity.Master'sdegreeorMBApreferred.Minimum3+yearsofrelatedexperience.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

None required.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

Excellentwrittenandverbalcommunicationskills.Strongorganizationalandanalyticalskills.Abilitytoprovideefficient,timely,reliableandcourteousservicetocustomers.Abilitytoeffectivelypresentinformation.

DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTICS

Excellent data management, manipulation, andanalysis skills. Ability to create integrated data models from disparatesources. Understanding of relational databases. Highly skilled in dashboarddesign and development. Intermediate to advanced Tableau skills are required. Proficiencyin database technologies such as Microsoft Access or SQL Server is preferred.

FINANCIAL AND STATISTICAL KNOWLEDGE

Requiresbasicknowledgeoffinancial and statistical termsandprinciples.

REASONINGABILITY

Abilitytocomprehend,analyze,andinterpretcomplexdata sets.Abilitytosolveproblemsinvolvingseveraloptionsinsituations.Requiresadvancedanalyticalandquantitativeskills.

OTHER SKILLS and/orABILITIES

AdvancedskillsinMicrosoftOfficeSuiteProducts,particularly Excel. Comfortable workingindependently and collaboratively.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisionsmadewiththoroughunderstandingofprocedures,companypolicies,andbusinesspracticestoachievegeneralresultsanddeadlines.Responsibleforsettingworkunitand/orprojectdeadlines.Errorsinjudgmentmaycauseshort-termimpacttodepartment.

The office is based out of Santa Barbara, CA,however work from home or another CBRE location is an option.

items.content: Aetea has been asked by their valued client, a leading healthcare services company, to assist with their need for a Data Warehouse Architect, with strong SQL Server experience. The client and the team you ll be working in are great and offer positive challenges in a dynamic environment. Position Summary Our client is seeking a Data Warehouse Architect to be part of the growing Enterprise Data team. This person will collaborate with practice stakeholders to translate their data-information-knowledge requirements into data warehouse solutions. This role requires demonstrated experiences with data warehouse strategy, planning, design, development and support This person should have had the primary role in creating and implementing a data warehouse in the past. This person will be responsible for design, coding standards, and mentoring ETL developers. Healthcare, and cloud experience is a plus. KEY ACCOUNTABILITY The Data Warehouse Architect is accountable for data warehouse strategic planning, requirements analysis, architecture, data modeling, meta data management, ETL design, development best practices, and deployment process. POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Align data warehouse architecture and function with the practice s strategic goals and objectives Create data warehouse technical and functional roadmap, current state to future state Provide expertise and thought leadership in data warehousing architecture, design and operations Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies, innovations, and service in data management Define solution architectures, frameworks, development standards, and data quality best practices Design and specify strategies for high availability, disaster recovery and backup. Implement and maintain solutions for modeling, ETL/API, data mining, and metadata management Analyze and represent practice information needs in data models Extend functional data warehouse capabilities through design and schema specification ETL and integrate data warehouse with applications, and data in support of reporting and analytics Guide key analysis and process in support of data quality and system performance Direct process and technologies to monitor and improve data warehouse ETL, integration, staging, data replication, and other operational functions. Mentor and assist ETL developers, and BI/AI analysts in their assimilation of best practices and standards Implement practices to ensure accuracy, validity, consistency, and usability of the data warehouse data Maintain technologies, practices, and standards for configuration, change, and release management Assist in team design, composition, structure, and budget planning Enable automation and improvements in data warehouse operations and support functions DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE B.S. in Computer Science / Software Engineering 10 years of relevant experience in a data integration, data warehouse roles At least 5 years of tech lead experience in a data architect role Experience with data architecture, data warehousing, and data modeling, within the healthcare sector Experience designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting large data warehouses Strong SQL Server background Strong understanding of database and data warehouse principles, theories, process, and practices Exceptional critical thinking, analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills Demonstrated aptitude for learning and assimilating new concepts and technologies Able to present ideas, concepts, and strategies in a manner consumable by business stakeholders Ability to effectively align work with stakeholder priorities and execute in a fast-paced environment Demonstrated team-oriented, collaborative behaviors and competencies Experience with dev/ops, cloud engineering, cloud-based database platforms a plus Familiarity with SSIS, SSRS, Tableau, Control-M, Jira, confluence, bit-bucket a plus Knowledge of HIPAA data privacy practices and laws a plus This is a great opportunity to get in with a stable and growing organization that values technology and the people that drive it. There is a lot more we can share with you about the role, so please contact me (or apply) at acoldironaetea.com or through the apply function listed. Duration : permanent Location : Remote REFERRAL FEES PAID up to 500 For more than 30 years, Aetea Information Technology has been the go-to partner for both premier clients and IT professionals alike. As a full spectrum IT Human Capital organization, we have experience in all industries, supporting clients ranging from emerging start-ups to Fortune 50. Our consultants value Aetea for their benefits, length of assignments, sequential employment opportunities, and compensation models; not to mention the attentiveness and world-class support you will receive from the internal Aetea team. - provided by Dice

This is a US-based remote position. Essential Job Functions: Work with stakeholders to understand scope, business requirements and translate them into technical design to support the SQL Server Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Lead the design and implementation of the EDW, related databases, and ETL processes Provide data architecture supporting our BI Reporting and Dashboard Visualization teams; includes assisting with building data models / DAX queries in Power BI Assist with implementing best practices for Data Warehouse/ETL Architecture as well as Data Management/Governance Help lead on-going data quality and data integrity initiatives through creation/expansion of audit processes, exception reports, and alerts Conduct design and code reviews to ensure adherence to best practices Create and maintain technical documentation Manage source code versioning and deployments Evaluate large and complex data sets SQL Query performance tuning/optimization Requirements: 7 years of hands-on experience with relational and dimensional data modeling 7 years working Microsoft SQL Server databases and SQL Service Integration Services (SSIS) Highly-motivated self-starter who is also comfortable working in a team-oriented and collaborative environment 3 years experience mentoring more junior Data Warehouse developers and helping to set development best practices for the team 2 years hands on experience with Power BI Excellent communication and problem-solving skills Experience working on Agile project teams Passion for solving complex business problems by designing clean, high-quality solutions Expert-level SQL development skills, including query performance tuning/optimization Knowledge of Source Control and Project Management tools, such as TFS and Git Preferred Skills: Experience developing Master Data Management solutions SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) Oracle PL/SQL C#/VB .Net Experience with Team Approach, Personify or other fundraising applications and/or CRM systems. - provided by Dice

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


About Monese


At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a current account can get one. By using bleeding-edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.


The first Monese products already serve well over a million people across the European Economic Area, and we have ambitious plans to add more products and features across many other regions.


About the role


We opened our doors 5 years ago, so obviously we have systems working and databases up and running, but this is a startup - ie we add functionality, polish stuff, expand and grow fast. We have planned the architecture of databases and optimised these, but you probably know there is a moment these kind of systems badly need a dedicated geek with experience to take over and own it.


So we are looking for someone who will make sure our mission critical systems are up and running and several aspects are taken care of:



  • Global scalability

  • Archiving

  • Optimising

  • Planning of distributed DB systems


Buzzwords: PostgreSQL, AWS, RDS, cloud, sharing, Linux




REQUIREMENTS


We are looking for you, if you:



  • know how to take maximum from PostgreSQL

  • can find ways how to optimize any query that runs in database

  • are capable design data models for backend services

  • are happy to share your knowledge and experience with team

  • feel comfortable to take lead and drive changes

  • know how to use schema versioning tools

  • have understanding about SaaS, IaaS and PaaS

  • are convinced that security and resilience is in your blood

  • think agility is your nick name

  • know what is right thing to do and you follow it


What we consider a plus:



  • Knowledge of scripting, business process modeling, machine learning and AI

  • Startup experience




BENEFITS


Benefits of working at Monese:



  • Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company

  • A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible

  • International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks

  • Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well

  • Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues

  • In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities

  • Flexible working schedule and possibility to work in home office from time to time

  • Dog-friendly office

  • Stock options and competitive salary


Sounds like something for you?


Please send your CV and cover letter in English.


We will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately so be quick to apply!


All candidates must be eligible to work in UK.

at Attunix

This position is flexible to work remote within the US.

Position Summary Our client is seeking a Data Warehouse Architect to be part of the growing Enterprise Data team. This person will collaborate with practice stakeholders to translate their data-information-knowledge requirements into data warehouse solutions. This role requires demonstrated experiences with data warehouse strategy, planning, design, development and support This person should have had the primary role in creating and implementing a data warehouse in the past. This person will be responsible for design, coding standards, and mentoring ETL developers. Healthcare, and cloud experience is a plus. KEY ACCOUNTABILITY The Data Warehouse Architect is accountable for data warehouse strategic planning, requirements analysis, architecture, data modeling, meta data management, ETL design, development best practices, and deployment process. POSITION DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Align data warehouse architecture and function with the practice s strategic goals and objectives Create data warehouse technical and functional roadmap, current state to future state Provide expertise and thought leadership in data warehousing architecture, design and operations Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies, innovations, and service in data management Define solution architectures, frameworks, development standards, and data quality best practices Design and specify strategies for high availability, disaster recovery and backup. Implement and maintain solutions for modeling, ETL/API, data mining, and metadata management Analyze and represent practice information needs in data models Extend functional data warehouse capabilities through design and schema specification ETL and integrate data warehouse with applications, and data in support of reporting and analytics Guide key analysis and process in support of data quality and system performance Direct process and technologies to monitor and improve data warehouse ETL, integration, staging, data replication, and other operational functions. Mentor and assist ETL developers, and BI/AI analysts in their assimilation of best practices and standards Implement practices to ensure accuracy, validity, consistency, and usability of the data warehouse data Maintain technologies, practices, and standards for configuration, change, and release management Assist in team design, composition, structure, and budget planning Enable automation and improvements in data warehouse operations and support functions DESIRED PROFESSIONAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE B.S. in Computer Science / Software Engineering 10 years of relevant experience in a data integration, data warehouse roles At least 5 years of tech lead experience in a data architect role Experience with data architecture, data warehousing, and data modeling, within the healthcare sector Experience designing, building, installing, configuring and supporting large data warehouses Strong SQL Server background Strong understanding of database and data warehouse principles, theories, process, and practices Exceptional critical thinking, analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving skills Demonstrated aptitude for learning and assimilating new concepts and technologies Able to present ideas, concepts, and strategies in a manner consumable by business stakeholders Ability to effectively align work with stakeholder priorities and execute in a fast-paced environment Demonstrated team-oriented, collaborative behaviors and competencies Experience with dev/ops, cloud engineering, cloud-based database platforms a plus Familiarity with SSIS, SSRS, Tableau, Control-M, Jira, confluence, bit-bucket a plus Knowledge of HIPAA data privacy practices and laws a plus This is a great opportunity to get in with a stable and growing organization that values technology and the people that drive it. There is a lot more we can share with you about the role, so please contact me (or apply) at acoldironaetea.com or through the apply function listed. Duration : permanent Location : Remote REFERRAL FEES PAID up to 500 For more than 30 years, Aetea Information Technology has been the go-to partner for both premier clients and IT professionals alike. As a full spectrum IT Human Capital organization, we have experience in all industries, supporting clients ranging from emerging start-ups to Fortune 50. Our consultants value Aetea for their benefits, length of assignments, sequential employment opportunities, and compensation models; not to mention the attentiveness and world-class support you will receive from the internal Aetea team. - provided by Dice

Database Architect

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Database Administrator, DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Education Technology, eLearning, Non-Profit
Company size: 201–500 people
Company: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. | No office location

Technologies

mysql
devops
sre
database-administration
sysadmin

Job description

Summary

Wikimedia's goal is to provide every single person with the sum of all human knowledge and MariaDB/MySQL is how we store it. You will be joining a small mission driven team of talented highly experienced engineers.  As one of the most highly trafficked sites, there is literally nowhere else serving as many page views per engineer. As a Database Architect at the Wikimedia Foundation, you will be responsible for the architecture, design, availability and performance of our database infrastructure in a globally distributed infrastructure. You will work together with our developers and SREs on optimizing queries, schema design and coming up with a data strategy. This is a unique opportunity to have a huge impact.  Our work is important, and it’s used by hundreds of millions of people.

Responsibilities

  • Drive research, architecture, design, and implementation of Wikimedia persistent data storage & query infrastructure
  • Coordinate and consult with and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams on data and query design for MediaWiki & associated services and projects
  • Be part of the team that is responsible for database performance tuning, high availability, backups, and general optimization.
  • Lead internal documentation efforts, mentor other staff in various aspects of Wikimedia infrastructure and services and lead by setting the example
  • Lead incident response, diagnosis and follow-up on system outages or alerts across Wikimedia’s production infrastructure
  • Share our values and work in accordance with them

Qualifications

  • Deep knowledge of database storage concepts and working experience with storage systems, architectures and concepts
  • Advanced level of experience with MariaDB or MySQL database administration and replication topologies at scale
  • In-depth knowledge of SQL and optimization of queries
  • Strong programming language skills and experience designing and developing software using relational databases at large scale
  • 5+ years experience in an DBA/SRE/Operations/DevOps role as part of a team
  • Advanced knowledge of Linux and IO/data storage internals and troubleshooting
  • Experience with managing geographically distributed, highly available, high traffic infrastructure based on Linux
  • Experience with Open Source configuration management and orchestration tools (Puppet, Ansible, Chef, SaltStack, etc.), as well as modern observability infrastructure (Prometheus, Grafana, Graphite, Logstash/Kibana, Icinga/Nagios, etc.)
  • Experience with managing remotely both bare-metal servers and virtualized environments
  • Strong English language skills
  • Ability to work independently, as an effective part of a globally distributed team, including ticket tracking systems and asynchronous communication tools
  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent in work experience

Optional qualifications

  • Experience with LAMP stack technologies (PHP/HHVM, memcached/Redis, MySQL) - MediaWiki experience is a definite plus
  • Experience with advanced distributed storage and database systems (Swift, Ceph, Cassandra, etc.) or graph databases (Titan, Blazegraph, etc.) is a big plus
  • Strong track record of open source contributions is a major plus

The Wikimedia Foundation is... 

...the nonprofit organization that hosts and operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply

U.S. Benefits & Perks*

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their eligible families (yes, fully paid premiums!)
  • The Wellness Program provides reimbursement for mind, body and soul activities such as fitness memberships, baby sitting, continuing education and much more
  • The 401(k) retirement plan offers matched contributions at 4% of annual salary
  • Flexible and generous time off - vacation, sick and volunteer days, plus 19 paid holidays - including the last week of the year.
  • Family friendly! 100% paid new parent leave for seven weeks plus an additional five weeks for pregnancy, flexible options to phase back in after leave, fully equipped lactation room.
  • For those emergency moments - long and short term disability, life insurance (2x salary) and an employee assistance program
  • Pre-tax savings plans for health care, child care, elder care, public transportation and parking expenses
  • Telecommuting and flexible work schedules available
  • Appropriate fuel for thinking and coding (aka, a pantry full of treats) and monthly massages to help staff relax
  • Great colleagues - diverse staff and contractors speaking dozens of languages from around the world, fantastic intellectual discourse, mission-driven and intensely passionate people

*Eligible international workers' benefits are specific to their location and dependent on their employer of record

More information

Wikimedia Foundation website

Wikimedia Foundation blog

Annual Report - 2017

Wikimedia 2030

Apply now

About Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.

The Wikimedia Foundation is...

...the nonprofit organization that supports Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge, free of interference. We host the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive financial support from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

The Wikimedia Foundation is an equal opportunity employer, and we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply.

Benefits

  • Fully paid premiums for medical, dental & vision insurance premiums
  • 401(k) with 4% matching contribution
  • 7-12 weeks parental leave with 100% pay + lactation room
  • Wellness Program ($1800 annual) to promote wellness & personal growth
  • Pre-tax savings plans for Transportation & Parking
  • Flexible work schedules and remote working options
  • Pet Friendly office
  • Commitment to diversity & inclusion throughout the employee lifecycle
  • 12 days vacation, 19 days holiday, 2 days volunteer work and more!
  • Lean more at https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/Work_with_us

items.content:
Linux Server Administrator at B3 Group

Remote | International

Delivery – Herndon, Virginia

B3 Group, Inc. is a fast-growing Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) certified health IT firm providing end-to-end technology support services to the federal government and enterprise customers. Our values-driven team of business, IT and management professionals blend innovation and client-first thinking to deliver sustainable solutions for better healthcare outcomes. Established in 2008 and located in Herndon, Virginia, B3 Group is founded on the principles of servant leadership. Those principles are reflected in every aspect of our operations.

B3 Group Inc is looking for a talented Linux Server Administrator/B3 Analyst to provide hands-on management of Linux RedHat Virtual Machines and associated resources within an AWS Cloud environment. This is a hands-on role responsible for the creation and ongoing maintenance of Linux RedHat Virtual Machines in support of a web application. The candidate will need experience working within a Cloud environment preferably AWS to guide a project migrating to the Cloud from an on-premises data center. The qualified candidate will demonstrate the ability to work with developers, Architects, and various geographically dispersed teams.
Telecommute may be considered.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide hands-on virtual machine administration in AWS across Development, Stage, and Production environments.
  • Perform Linux server administration including OS, patches, update dependencies, user creation, create and execute scripts.
  • Work with the AWS Console to create and manage VM and associated resources. Perform server hardening activities.
  • Ensure Virtual Machines meet client networking and vulnerability standards. Recommend and implement best practices for server maintenance.
  • Access VMs via a jumpbox using Reflection Workspace.
  • Create, manage and acquire certificates. Collaborate with teams to configure and register DNS. Collaborate with other teams to provide resource inventory.
  • Manage EC2 across Development, PreProduction, Production environments.
  • Perform backup and recovery of Linux EC2.
  • Collaborate with other teams to identify and create capacity and configuration needs.
  • Troubleshoot issues as they arise including configuration and performance issues.
  • Configure AWS security groups as needed. Capture EC2 images as required.
  • Monitor reporting/alarming tools, KPIs, look for issues, errors, inconsistencies, anomalies, etc. to ensure nominal system health.
  • Contribute to and Author documentation pertaining to Servers as needed.

As a B3 Analyst, you will effectively understand project data to create overall assessment while considering functional benefits, technical performance, risks, and schedule concerns. They will be able to identify trends and errors. They will be able to review data and have strong report writing skills. The Analyst will work with customers, users and project leads in analyzing, designing, implementing and supporting IT business applications and systems. A B3 Analyst will demonstrate pro-activeness, an eagerness to learn, good attitude, and collaboration.

In order to be successful in this position, we expect you to have the following knowledge, skills, and abilities;

  • Bachelor’s Degree required. In lieu of degree, 8 additional years of experience will be considered.
  • At least 5+ years of experience in LINUX system administration, preferably within DoD contractor environment.
  • At least 3+ years of Unix/Linux Shell scripting, Bash, Perl, Python and other languages.
  • Experience with centralized authentication technologies such as Active Directory domains in supporting Linux is desirable.
  • Demonstrate excellent written and verbal skills and ability to clearly articulate ideas, analysis, issues to team, stakeholders, and management.
  • Network\Firewall configuration.
  • Secure client communications – SSL, XWin, VNC, SAMBA. Installed and upgraded patches, firmware, MP, GSP, BIOS and security.
  • Experience supporting HTTP, FTP.
  • Strong aptitude to learn and adapt to technology.
  • Ability to adapt well to diverse environments and ability to communicate clearly with all levels in an organization.
  • Detail oriented with strong analytical, organizational, and time management skills.
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain public trust clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Demonstrated experience in the use Agile methodology and processes.
  • Experience supporting DoD, Department of Veterans Affairs or other federal organizations.
  • Familiarity with Automation.
  • AWS Administration skills.
  • Windows Experience.
  • Powershell.
  • Jenkins experience.

Successful B3 Group employees will display the following characteristics:

  • You strive to be an expert in your field currently and in the future.
  • You take care in learning your customer’s business and drivers in order to ensure solutions meet not only technical needs, but also support their mission properly in a way that meeting their client’s mission.
  • You like to make your client look good.
  • You find solutions, where others only see problems.
  • You are proactive, you make and meet commitments, and you perform your duties exceedingly well.
  • You are aware of the client’s needs at all times and are well-versed in what both your team and B3 Group can offer them as a whole.
  • You have the ability to work with diverse, integrated, deliverable-driven teams to accomplish the larger mission.

Our Benefits;

Our reputation is built upon the talents and integrity of our employees. We value the contributions of each and every person who is a member of our organization. We offer challenging career opportunities, competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package to include the following:

  • Paid Federal Holidays
  • Paid Time off
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • 401(k) plan with contribution match
  • Professional Development Assistance
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance
  • Short (STD) and Long-Term Disability (LTD) Insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Performance Bonuses

B3 Group, Inc. does not discriminate in employment opportunities, terms and conditions of employment, or practices on the basis of race, age, gender, religious or political beliefs, national origin or heritage, disability, sexual orientation, or any characteristic protected by law.

Employment Type: Full time

Minimum Experience: Mid-level

items.content:
Position: MS SQL Server DBA Architect/ Performance tuning expert

Location: Alberta, Edmonton, Canada. Can support remotely from US too

Duration: 3-6 months

One of our clients is looking for help with an assessment to use Looker datalake analytics tool against a custom develop

Solutions they are looking at are:

Turning on change tracking as is use lighter weight like fivetran

Alternative non-change tracking full data replication all the time or migrate their database to cloud where we can be more in control log replication

We need someone to review and assess what would be the best solution to allow for the parent to replicate and perform analytics against a custom application data. The database is SQL but is complex with 12 schemas and 5000+ tables and new tables are created on a daily basis with millions of records (this probably could be re-architected into stored queries procedures rather than creating new tables).

The parent usually uses a tool called Looker to replicate the data into a data lake to perform the analytics but so far are struggling to get it to work without turning on change tracking. They are not sure what the performance hit might be for turning on change tracking. Performance is a concern as we had to bump up the server to get it to hit spec and can t go bigger in the current co-lo cloud environment (maybe move it or a replica somewhere else).

- provided by Dice

Senior MySQL Database Administrator at Datavail

Remote

Location: Anywhere, USA

Job Code: 444

# of Openings: 1

Position Description

Datavail

Title: MySQL DBA

PLEASE NOTE: Must be US Citizen due to ITAR+ Requirements

Location: Anywhere USA is possible

Status: Fulltime Employee role

Datavail is looking for a MySQL Database Administrator to assist our growing practice. Our company provides 24 X 7 support for our customer’s mission critical database systems, which is possible through our proven model of Tier 3 DBAs in the U.S. and our Tier 2 teams in India. This model allows our DBAs to provide superior service to our customers, without our DBAs having to sacrifice their lives.

Here are the skills you will bring to the table and use daily in supporting our clients:

  • 5-12 years in MySQL
  • Well versed in database performance tuning and SQL tuning
  • Skilled in backups & recovery
  • 24×7 production support experience
  • Development DBA experience
  • Intimate with SQL
  • MySQL 5.1, 5.5, 5.6, 5.7
  • Oracle Enterprise MySQL, Community MySQL, Percona MySQL, and MariaDB
  • Clustering: Galera, InnoDB Cluster, NDB
  • Sharding and partitioning
  • Replication: master-slave, master-master-slave, master-master
  • Restoring: point-in-time, restore a master
  • Backups: table, databases, utilities needed for backing up, affects on table types
  • Query tuning: adding/removing indexes, rewriting queries for better performance
  • Configuration tuning: for query and overall database performance
  • MySQL troubleshooting
  • Installation on Linux OSes and Windows, and upgrades on Linux OSes and Windows
  • Intermediate knowledge of Linux with regard to moving and compressing files, creating users, firewalls, networking, and simple troubleshooting

Experience in the following areas is strongly preferred (but not mandatory):

  • Percona toolkit
  • InnoDB Cluster/Router, NDB, MariaDB and other MySQL forks, including Galera cluster are a plus
  • MongoDB
  • PostgreSQL
  • MySQL DBA Certifications would be a plus

Miscellaneous preferred knowledge:

  • Database modeling & design (normalization, physical design, etc.)
  • Working with clients
  • Managing junior DBAs
  • EXCELLENT communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Ability to work well with others in a team environment
  • Willing to carry on-call cell-phone/pager

This position is for full-time employment with full medical benefits. Telecommute remotely. Salary commensurate with experience. US citizenship required If you meet the above requirements and would enjoy working in a thriving fast-faced environment where one can attain the technical satisfaction of supporting several complex customer environments with the stability of working for a single company as a full-time employee, please apply online through our ATS system for fastest response time.

Thank you for your interest in Datavail!

items.content:
Business Intelligence Architect

Toggl is an easy to use and flexible time tracking tool that helps 3+ million users see where their work time goes, so they can focus on the projects that really matter. It works on all your devices and integrates with over a 100 tools.

Our team is looking for a Business Intelligence Architect to expand our data-driven decision-making capabilities for both product and business development.

The role
You will join our operations team and take ownership of the data pipeline, reporting and business intelligence tools. Your will focus on forming our data architecture, including setting up a data warehouse and implementing systems to manage and present data. You will also expand our reporting capabilities, identify trends and patterns in data, visualize data in ways approachable to the whole company and try new techniques so that we can make better decisions and make them faster. You will have an impact on our success by identifying and mapping our business requirements and prioritizing stakeholder needs.

About you
You will be a good fit for this role if you are fluent in SQL and able to code (Python, Go, or similar) on an intermediate level. You have hands-on experience with BI tools and knowledge of the trends in the field. Also, you have done statistical analysis (median, correlations, regression analysis) and get excited when identifying patterns in massive amounts of data. You are a fan of a systematic and organized approach in data visualization. While we have a supportive and close-knit team, you will really excel at working with us if you are able to work independently and love bringing your own initiatives to the table.

About our team
Toggl is a distributed team of 80+ people working remotely from 30 countries. We take pride in our professional, learning-oriented and friendly working environment that values work-life balance and constantly doing our best in every aspect of our work. You can work from anywhere in the world, because we know great people do awesome work wherever they are. Every few months we travel to meet up somewhere in the world and spend some quality time together. Our business is profitable with a healthy margin and we’re built with no outside investments, so you can count on a stable working environment.

Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work from.
  • 28 calendar days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays.
  • 2 company retreats plus 2 team meetups a year (expenses covered) for team-building.
  • Laptop and a €2,000 budget to set up your home office.
  • Reimbursement for co-working space rent or internet service at home.
  • Opportunities to attend trainings, workshops or conferences.
  • Monthly reimbursement for gym membership, massage and other things to improve your health.
  • Support for buying a phone, eyeglasses or tools you need for doing your best work.

The salary for this position is EUR 50,000 annually.

Apply now!
All it takes to apply is answering a short skills test that assesses your expertise. Please note that only candidates who take the test will be considered.

Free Toggl t-shirt for those who do well on the test!

items.content:
Business Intelligence Operator at Cardinal Financial

Remote

Department: Business Intelligence

Location: Remote

Who We Are:

Cardinal Financial is a nationwide direct mortgage lender whose mission is to prove that homeownership is possible for everyone. By bringing an open-minded approach to an often closed-minded industry, we’re able to embrace every unique financial situation differently in order to craft the best possible loans for our borrowers. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service backed by our groundbreaking technology, and these two components of our process come together to complete a simple, personalized mortgage experience. But it all starts with our people.

We believe that no matter where you fit in our organization—Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, or even re-stocking the break rooms with endless coffee supplies—everyone can influence the experience that we provide to our customers and our partners. We tell our customers and our partners that anything can be reimagined. So why not your career? Looking to join a company that values its people, innovates and expands on its proprietary technology, and is growing at a ridiculous rate?!

Who We Need:

The Business Intelligence Operator will report to the Business Intelligence Architect and have responsibility for ensuring data loads for the firm’s data warehouse environment occur on schedule and completes successfully. This includes but is not limited to ensuring all data is loaded via data quality checks as well as ensuring errors are recorded, communicated, and brought to resolution.

The ideal candidate will have experience working with data in multiple formats, aware of how to work with multiple data sources, and a general understanding of databases and data analytics. The position requires a person to be detail-oriented, have basic ability to analyze data using spreadsheets or other tools, is highly organized and able to meet strict schedules. For example, staging data loads and reviewing data results at a specific time each day and ensure the details of any unexpected time delays or errors are recorded as directed.

What You Will Do:

  • Follow procedures to acquire and publish data from or to multiple sources
  • Use tools like Microsoft Excel, text editors, etc. to manually prepare data, as directed; for example, cleansing and format data to be successfully loaded to the data warehouse
  • Make minor modifications to SQL scripts, execute the scripts, and escalate any errors that cannot be resolved
  • Work with other team members and multiple areas of the business to resolve any errors that occur during the data load processes; for example, SQL errors, source data issues, etc.
  • Maintain procedure documentation to ensure it matches actions being performed
  • Assist with the testing of changes to the data load process
  • Assist with the resolution of Business Intelligence support requests
  • Assist with general Business Intelligence issues, as directed

What You Need:

  • Equivalent experience or Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting and/or Information Systems.
  • Experience or college-level coursework related to data analysis and/or database programming.
  • Spreadsheet skills (advanced formulas and/or macros).
  • Understanding of data analysis techniques and/or database design techniques.
  • Knowledge of information systems.
  • Experience with MySQL, MS SQL Server, OAC/OBIEE, Tableau and Python is a plus.
  • Understanding of financial services like Banking and/or Mortgage is a plus.
  • Can complete work in a highly collaborative environment by being proactive in working with your supervisor and other colleagues to resolve questions, issues, or concerns.
  • Able to manage sensitive and confidential information.
  • Excellent customer facing/customer service skills and a passion for service improvement.
  • Good business writing skills.
  • An ability to understand the activities of other roles related to Business Intelligence or Business Analysis is desired.

What We Offer:

  • Strength, Stability, and Vision.
  • An empowered culture where your ideas are important and your voice matters.
  • Opportunity for career growth.
  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Benefits that become effective the first day of the month following your start date including – Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and much more.
  • 401K w/ 50% match up to a maximum employee contribution of 5%- Effective the 1st of the month following 30-days of employment.
Apply for job

items.content:
• Senior Database Developer
  • Glasgow
  • Up to £55,000 DOE + Leading benefits package

Role Overview

Sanderson are working alongside a global financial institution who operate at the forefront of technology, who are currently looking for a Senior Database Developer to join a team which is projected to double in size over the next 12 months as a result of an ongoing growth initiative being undertaken by the business.

This role would give the successful applicant the chance to work on a complex system which is seen as one of the most important assets within the business. Due to the complexity of the system, the employer is looking for someone who sees themselves as a “SQL Expert” with a desire to learn new skills and new ways of working. The employer offers a competitive salary, a leading benefits package, flexible and remote working options, career progression opportunities within a global organisation and much more.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Advanced SQL Development skills
  • Knowledge of Perl Scripting (or the willingness to learn)
  • Exposure to Linux scripting would be advantageous however someone who is willing to learn would also be considered.
  • The successful applicant should be comfortable working within a global team, there are currently SME’s on this platform around the world.
  • Experience creating stored procedures
  • Experience creating table partitions

Responsibilities

  • Deliver high quality code (SQL and Perl) under direction of a project manager/team lead.
  • Optimise/extend existing complex SQL queries
  • Potential to re-write entire sections of the system

Benefits

  • Market Leading pension
  • Competitive holidays with a buy/sell option
  • Preferential rates on financial products
  • Progression opportunities within 6 – 12 months
  • Performance related bonus of up to 15%
  • Opportunity to learn new technologies.

Please contact Ryan Finch on 0141 428 4272 should you have any questions or for a confidential discussion, or apply below.

Glasgow
Permanent
£55,000 a year
